lexUnit.name: humiliate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: injure the dignity and self-respect of.

sentence.text: I want you , and I do n't care how humiliated I am in the process .

Officially , the force was supposed to go in by invitation only ; avoid looking like the heavy mob ; and not humiliate authorities which felt they were hounded because they were struggling to cope on their own .

It is the ingrained contempt , the impulse , apparently deliberately inculcated , to humiliate which , in the eyes of enlightened Israelis , is perhaps more revealing , more frightening in its ultimate implications , than all the well-documented brutalities .

It did n't occur to you that we go away from here to be private , that our holidays are our own affair , that it might humiliate me to have Edwin Lorrimer know that I ca n't afford to take you to Venice , even on a ten-day package tour .
The following day Col. Toumba Boubacar , the Chief of Staff , threatened a coup against the conference , which he said was trying to humiliate the army .
Usually the object of the exercise is to shock , disgust or humiliate the unwilling audience , rather than injure .
The couple systematically bullied and humiliated the children , often for fun , said Sonia Woodley , prosecuting .

No matter how it embarrasses or humiliates her children , action will now be taken to protect both the Queen and her grandchildren from what she considers the very real threat of the end of the monarchy .
It is possible , however , that Khrushchev had decided beforehand that the summit was not going to deliver what he required , and he therefore set out to wreck it or humiliate Eisenhower .
She decides at this point in the story , that nothing is too bad for those people who have tried to humiliate her throughout her life .
I was the only woman to whom he was sufficiently drawn ; and he chose , out of fear , to humiliate me .
You are determined to humiliate me ? "
Not only will he be one of the few Democrats to win the presidency in the past 50 years but he will have humiliated an incumbent President in the process .
The players become cold and indifferent when they do not follow the soloist directly ; the stick that directs them humiliates them , takes away their natural wish to excel
` Why should your father want to humiliate you ? "
Miranda was puzzled and humiliated by Adam 's rejection .
You are humiliated by your wife leaving you .
Bill was badly humiliated at the airfield today .
She was n't being humiliated , she was just doing her job .
In a choice between meekly obeying his commands and being publicly humiliated there really was no choice .
Galileo was humiliated in Rome in a manner that has no exact parallel in Protestant countries .
At first I was humiliated to tears ; later I became hardened ; later still I accepted it as a fact and did not even try to deny it .
Back in 1989 the England side was at an extremely low ebb , having just been humiliated 0-4 by Australia .
We ca n't hurt her -- humiliate her like this when she 's expecting to marry him in just a few weeks , even if it has been arranged for family reasons , and not for love .
MILLIONS of TV viewers around the world witnessed Mr Mellor as he tried to humiliate an Israeli army colonel who arrested a Palestinian boy .
Lord Tebbit humiliated Premier John Major with a withering and sneering condemnation of his policies on Europe and the economy .
If the Gentlemen won now , he would have humiliated the Russians and the French .
Grown men should n't humiliate themselves like this .
You go to prison for something you 've done wrong , that 's your punishment , but they do n't need to humiliate you in the way they do .
